content.rendered:
At the moment there has been no general statement on social networks, but the company is beginning to respond to user complaints by assuming this general incidence:

“Currently there is a general incidence. Our technicians are already working to solve it as soon as possible. We feel the inconvenience caused. All the best”.

Hello Luis. I’m Patricia. Currently there is a general incidence. Our technicians are already working to solve it as soon as possible. We feel the inconvenience caused. All the best.

– Movistar Spain (@movistar_es) May 20, 2022

In Downdetector, a peak of reports has been detected that exceeds the 1374 claims, mainly claiming mobile connection problems with 86%. The main cities affected seem to be Madrid, Barcelona, ​​Seville and Valencia according to the origin of these reports, although others with less population such as Valladolid, Pamplona or Zaragoza continue to be added.

I’m sorry I don’t have any news at the moment, we hope that the incident is resolved as soon as possible.
All the best.

– Movistar Spain (@movistar_es) May 20, 2022

Business lines affected

According to the complaints from users, it seems that the problem is mainly focused on the company’s mobile business lines. With Friday being a business day, many users are complaining about not being able to make the necessary calls in their businesses.

At 11:00 AM, the incident remains unresolved and through official channels they cannot even give an estimated resolution time for this service outage.

Sorry for the inconvenience. We do not have an estimated time. We will try to solve it as soon as possible. Greetings.

– Movistar Spain (@movistar_es) May 20, 2022

“Sorry for the inconvenience. We do not have an estimated time. We will try to resolve it as soon as possible. Greetings”

Hello. I am Emily. Apologize for the time without service. We have reported an incident that affects the company lines. The technicians are working to have the service restored as soon as possible. Greetings

– Movistar Spain (@movistar_es) May 20, 2022

“Hello. I am Emily. Apologize for the time without service. We have reported an incident that affects the company lines. The technicians are working to have the service restored as soon as possible. Greetings”

Hello Antonio. I am Merche. I’m sorry but we have an active impact on calls from corporate mobiles. Our technicians are reviewing it as a priority.
All the best.

– Movistar Spain (@movistar_es) May 20, 2022

«We have an active impact on corporate mobile calls. Our technicians are reviewing it as a priority.

.@movistar_es Again more than 1 hour without being able to make or receive calls. As a client of Movistar Empresas, I can understand a breakdown, but what I cannot accept is the non-existence of a customer service. Neither by phone nor by chat. Any.

– Daniel V González (@_danielvga_) May 20, 2022

Through the Telefónica PYMES account we have been able to find out more details about the nature of the incident in question.

Hello. An incident has been detected that affects the issuance of fixed and mobile voice calls from corporate lines in Volte terminals.

The technical team is working to resolve it as soon as possible.

Sorry for the disturbances.

– Telefónica SMEs (@TE_pymes) May 20, 2022

“Hello. An incident has been detected affects the issuance of landline and mobile voice calls from corporate lines in Volte terminals. The technical team is working to resolve it as soon as possible. Sorry for the disturbances”.

Update 1:00 p.m.: It seems that little by little the situation has been fixed. Downdetector reports have practically disappeared and many users are already confirming the restoration of their line on social networks.

Thanks for letting us know. We are glad that it has been resolved.

– Movistar Spain (@movistar_es) May 20, 2022

We are glad that it has been resolved, Esteban. If you need us again, we are at your disposal. All the best.

– Movistar Spain (@movistar_es) May 20, 2022
